stories.text:
In November last year, I had made a donation online, to a non-profit.

Fast forward today, I notice the monthly donation and want to cancel it going forward. There is no way to do it online. So I call them up, the person says they can't help and I should leave my number and they'd call back. I ask them politely why they make it so easy to give money, but so difficult to cancel. They give some word-soup answer, a collection of words which sounded like a sentence but with zero meaning or usefulness.

By now, we are all familiar with this "model", the most (in)famous example being the NT Times. Looks like non-profits have started doing it too, which is depressing.

How does one handle these, short of stopping use of credit cards completely online? Is there any recourse at all?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you handle hard to cancel subscriptions/donations?
